comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I spy with my little eye something beginning with "T".  Looking bigger than ever ...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Trying to find out what the building behind The Tree was. On the 1858 map it is marked as "Police Magistrate" - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-rm1272-sd&rgn=... On the 1895 map it seems to be connected with the Police Barracks (which were moved to Surry Hills).- www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=... Any ideas peeps?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I wonder if there is a whole series of photos from this angle?  Time-lapse!

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: i read somewhere they wanted to Hyde Park to be the new Railway Terminus, but that idea got howled down Carters' Barracks was next to the Police Magistrate on the map "...Pitt St., cnr. Eddy Avenue. These barracks were built to accommodate 200 male convicts and, in a separate building, 100 male juvenile offenders. The carters in government employ, their working horses, bullocks and carts were housed here.The boys were kept separate from the men, in the hope that they would be improved in behaviour and not corrupted by older felons. But the experiment was not a particular success..." www.ozpotterycollectors.com/web_images/carter%20barracks%... Maybe a bit of law and order was needed around the cattle and corn markets

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] That's great! 8 images from April to November 1903.  Someone should make a movie ... next rainy day.
